newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Seoul yields end flat, talks on May issues affect.
newsitem.headline: Seoul yields end flat, talks on May issues affect.

text.p: Yields on three-year benchmark corporate bonds ended flat on Monday after fluctuating from 12.40 to 12.45 percent as the forecasts of May new issues varied, dealers said.
They said three-month CD yields ended lower as the overnight call rates continued to fall, prompting a drop in CD issues.
* 3-mth CDs end at 13.10 pct vs 13.15 pct
* Overnight average call rate at 12.47 pct vs 12.60 pct

"The three-year yields fell in the morning to 12.40 then rose to 12.45 on expectations that May issues would be about 2.7 trillion won, up 200-300 billion won from April," said Kang Yung-gee at Hyundai Securities.
He said the yields fell when afternoon forcasts showed next month's issues being closer to this month's.
Rates on three-month commercial papers (CPs) fell 10 basis points to 13.10 percent even ahead of the deadline on Friday for value added tax payments. This also helped pull down CD yields.
